title: Benefits and Drawbacks of Holding Waste Management Inc Stock for the Long Term

content.section: Benefits of holding Waste Management Inc stock
content.text: 1. Steady and reliable revenue: Waste Management operates in a sector that is essential and recession-resistant. People and businesses will always generate waste, ensuring a steady stream of revenue for the company.

content.section: Benefits of holding Waste Management Inc stock
content.text: 2. Long-term growth potential: As the world becomes more environmentally conscious, waste management and recycling services are expected to experience increased demand. Waste Management has been actively investing in innovative technologies and expanding its recycling capabilities, positioning itself for long-term growth.

content.section: Benefits of holding Waste Management Inc stock
content.text: 3. Dividend payments: Waste Management is known for its consistent and growing dividend payments. Holding the stock for the long term allows investors to benefit from potentially increasing dividend payouts, providing a steady income stream.

content.section: Drawbacks of holding Waste Management Inc stock
content.text: 1. Regulatory risks: The waste management industry is subject to extensive regulations, which can be burdensome and costly. Changes in regulations or new compliance requirements may affect the company's profitability and operations.

content.section: Drawbacks of holding Waste Management Inc stock
content.text: 2. Economic dependence: Waste Management's financial performance is tied to the overall economy. During economic downturns, businesses and consumers may reduce waste generation, impacting the company's revenue.

content.section: Drawbacks of holding Waste Management Inc stock
content.text: 3. Competitive landscape: Waste management is a competitive industry with several established players and potential disruptors. Increased competition can put pressure on pricing and profit margins, affecting the company's profitability.

Holding Waste Management Inc stock for the long term can offer investors steady and reliable revenue, long-term growth potential, and dividend payments. However, there are also regulatory risks, economic dependence, and a competitive landscape to consider. Investors should carefully assess their risk tolerance and long-term investment goals before making a decision.

news.headline: WM Announces Plan to Increase its Dividend Rate and a Refreshed $1.5 Billion Share Repurchase Authorization
news.summary: HOUSTON, December 11, 2023--WM (NYSE: WM) today announced that its Board of Directors has approved a 7.1% increase in the planned quarterly dividend rate for 2024, from $0.70 to $0.75 per share. The annual dividend rate increase from $2.80 to $3.00 per share marks the twenty-first consecutive year of dividend rate increases. news.headline: Here's Why We're Adding Waste Management to the Bullpen
news.summary: With three of the stock market's four major indexes moving lower today, suggesting the December move lower that we and others have been expecting is starting to unfold, we are continuing to refresh the Action Alerts PLUS Bullpen with the addition of Waste Management  .  Whether it's once or in some cases twice a week, garbage and recycling are picked up regularly for a variety of reasons, including keeping neighborhoods clean and sanitary.  The recurring nature of this business drives free cash flow, so much that over the last 20 years, Waste Management has consistently boosted its quarterly dividend, one that currently resides at $0.70 per share and offers an annualized dividend yield of 1.6%.
